intro: Phlegmariurus magnusianus, commonly known as the giant haircap moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and dense, hairy leaf-like structures that give it its common name. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. Its spore-producing capsules are borne on short stalks at the tips of the stems. Phlegmariurus magnusianus plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
